name: Akaroa Cottages - Heritage Boutique Collection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night in Jan 2011. I think we had a cottage called Overton. One bedroom cottage with a good size lounge, kitchen area and a small deck with a view of the town in the distance.
reviews.title: Nice but not amazing

reviews.text: It is a fair hike out of town - a car is essential. I'm not sure I'd fancy a walk back up the hill in the dark.
reviews.title: Great little hideaway in Akaroa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the plus side, the cottage was very nice. Loads of space for two people. It made a really pleasant change from hotel rooms.
reviews.title: Cozy cabins with a view out over Akaroa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One thing we weren't keen on - the spa bath - we turned it on and lots of brown/black bits came out of it. No idea what... told reception in the morning, they didn't seem overly phased.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.text: This place is ok - lots going for it, but if you want to be able to walk around the town after a couple of glasses of the local vino, you'd be better off staying in the town. It's generally a quiet town so I'm sure there are some other lovely places.
reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY A DREAM

reviews.text: We stayed here for one night - 2 adults and one toddler, the cottage was lovely - set out of the way so our little boy could play putside without worrying about passing cars. The room was really lovely, had sky TV and all the amenties you could need - large Spa bath. The town isn't too far and would be walkable if it was just adults but as you have to go on a main road without a path we felt we couldn't walk it with our little boy - it would be a bonus to the place if there was safe path into town.
reviews.title: Beautiful setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for one night as part of a trip to Akaroa to celebrate his birthday. Our cottage (bush view) was clean and comfortable but did not live up to the photos on the website.
reviews.title: Overpriced for what we got

reviews.text: Given that it was called a 'bush view' cottage, I was expecting romantic seclusion. In reality, the cottage was only about 10 or so metres from the gravel road that guests use to get round the property, and when we sat outside, we could clearly hear the conversation of the guests in the cottage next to ours and behind some trees. In addition, there was no outdoor furniture (unlike what is shown on the website) so we had to drag the indoor seats outside to sit on the deck. None of this was a big deal but it just wasn't what I was expecting/hoping for, especially after having viewed the website. In terms of the overall location, the property is very handy to Akaroa but it's nice to be just out of town.
reviews.title: Beautiful view and accomodation

reviews.text: When you pay $180 a night, you expect to get something special. Our cottage had some very nice touches, like the curtains, the log burner, and the flowers in the vase on the table. But the kitchen unit was somewhat tatty and had chips in the paint and woodwork, the tiles around the bath/shower had a grubby black edge where they met the bathtub and were peeling in places, and the toilet roll holder in the loo had obviously come off or been taken off the wall at some point, and the resulting hole had merely been filled with putty and not even painted over. Same with a spot on the bathroom wall where something had obviously been removed or perhaps the wall had been damaged - just putty and no paint job.
reviews.title: Fantastic view and terrific hosts!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All little things, but they gave the cottage a scruffy edge and it didn't make for the luxurious feel shown in the Akaroa Cottages (selective) website photos.
reviews.title: What a view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a reasonable distance from town. you could walk, but would be 20 mins to the main shops probably. Also the drive in and around the cottages are gravel and in places very steep. Not an issue but could be in the winter.
reviews.title: Lovely place to stay

reviews.text: The cottages are lovely, we stayed in bushside which was nice and called a seaview but were quite disappointed that was mainly obscured by trees. Staff were friendly at the front desk and local fudge was a great treat to arrive to.
reviews.title: Gorgeous views from quiet cottage

reviews.text: The views from the Akaroa cottages are gorgeous.
reviews.title: picture perfect

reviews.text: The cottages are spacious with very comfortable beds.
reviews.title: Lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the fudge on our bed!
reviews.title: Fabulous little retreat with total privacy

reviews.text: These beautiful cottages are set in the most scenic location, a short walk out of Akaroa. Megan and Kyle were so hospitable during our stay - would stay there again in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Amazing view and fantastic hospitality!

reviews.text: We stayed in the three bedroom cottage and found it perfect to our needs. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and would highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Loved our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only negative was that it would've been nice to walk to the town but the busy road prevents this but again that's the not the fault of the owners.
reviews.title: Private Loved it, Pot bellied stove a bonus

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Quite small but very private and great views. Clean, excellent accommodation. Short drive to town. Loved the pot bellied stove easy to light. Romantic.
reviews.title: Very relaxing stay

reviews.text: Self contained cottage with continental style breakfast provided evening before. Lovely location , a pleasant walk into Akaroa. The TV/DVD was a bit old. Didnt bother us too much but nedds upgrading for me to give 5 stars.
reviews.title: Nicely tucked away fromthe outside world yet close to civilization if you feel the need

description: Akaroa Cottages is now part of Heritage Hotels group (Heritage Hotels), and is managed also by managers Megan and Kyle Hazeldine. We have recently upgraded most of our cottages with new curtains, carpet and paint with some new furnishings. Perfectly located just 1.5 kilometres from the historic and unique French settlement of Akaroa, this idyllic boutique resort offers luxurious self-contained accommodation in a truly magnificent setting. Capturing the charm of this special location, Akaroa Cottages are crafted from timber and stone and are surrounded by tranquil native bush. These Private spacious cottages are complemented by stunning views of the beautiful Akaroa Harbour and the undulating hills of Banks Peninsula. Most of the Cottages have Double Corner Spa baths, Log burners and Views and they are all privately set. We cater for groups, couples weddings and Families.
